etymologies: early 20th century. From German Menthan from menth- (in Menthene (now Menthen)) + -an

definitions: Any of three isomeric saturated cyclic liquid hydrocarbons, CH₃ ·C₆ H₁₀ ·CH(CH₃)₂ (methylisopropylcyclohexane); especially the para -isomer, on whose carbon skeleton many terpenes are based.
